intro: Lithraea laurina, commonly known as the golden lily or silver tree, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a small, evergreen shrub or tree that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. Lithraea laurina is well adapted to coastal environments, tolerating salt spray and strong winds. It plays an important role in stabilizing dunes and supporting local wildlife.
